page.title: 20Features of the church
page.content: The North Aisle is a war memorial Chapel. In the porch the name Hazelbury Bryan has been arased because of the danger of invasion in 1940. It is a memorial of the enemys' defeat. The tower is over 60 feet and yet the belfry windows are small. A scratch dial of the middle ages can be seen near the ground, and a more modern sundial is further up. The church has six bells, a poor lands charity tablet records that a rent is paid forcertain fields in the village and is distributed to the poor. The lecturn has a black oak section which originated from a pile of a Roman bridge. Fragments of old stained glass are in the East window of the chancel retieved after the dustruction by the Roundheads.
